title: Historical Stock Price Performance of One Liberty Properties Inc

content.text: 1. Dot-Com Bubble: The dot-com bubble occurred from 1997 to 2000, characterized by excessive speculation in internet-based companies. One Liberty Properties Inc, being a real estate investment trust, was not directly impacted by the dot-com bubble.

2. September 11 Attacks: The September 11 attacks in 2001 led to a temporary market shutdown and a significant decline in stock prices. One Liberty Properties Inc also experienced a decline during this time.

3. 2008 Financial Crisis: The 2008 financial crisis was triggered by the collapse of Lehman Brothers, leading to a global recession. One Liberty Properties Inc's stock price experienced a sharp decline during this time but subsequently recovered.

4. COVID-19 Pandemic: The COVID-19 pandemic, which began in early 2020, caused widespread market volatility and economic uncertainty. One Liberty Properties Inc's stock price initially plummeted but later regained some ground as the market stabilized.
One Liberty Properties Inc's stock price has exhibited volatility during significant market events. It tends to be impacted by market downturns but has shown resilience in recovering over time.

One Liberty Properties Inc's stock price is influenced by market events, such as crashes or rallies. Understanding historical context and analyzing the company's response to such events can provide insights for investors.

news.headline: One Liberty Properties Announces 125th Consecutive Quarterly Dividend
news.summary: – Increased or Maintained Dividend for Over 30 Consecutive Years – GREAT NECK, N.Y., March 04, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- One Liberty Properties, Inc. (NYSE: OLP) today announced that its Board of Directors declared a quarterly dividend on the Company’s common stock of $0.45 per share. The dividend is payable on April 4, 2024 to stockholders of record at the close of business on March 27, 2024, and represents One Liberty’s 125th consecutive quarterly dividend.
